Univariate Outlier Detection

univOutliers.Rd

Provides three methods for detecting univariate outliers in a dataset.

Usage

univOutliers(data, x = NULL, method = "boxplot")

Arguments

data

A data frame containing the variable to be analyzed.

x

A character string naming the numeric variable to assess for outliers.

method

A character supplying the method used for outlier detection. Methods are boxplot, mad, and grubbs.

Value

A list containing the ggplot object and boxplot statistics.

Examples

# Generate example data
set.seed(42)
library(EnvStats)
#> Error in library(EnvStats): there is no package called 'EnvStats'
data1 <- data.frame(
  var1 = rnorm(100, mean = 50, sd = 10),
  var2 = c(rnorm(97, mean = 50, sd = 10), 150, 160, 170),
  var3 = sample(1:100, 100, replace = TRUE, prob = (1:100)^2))


# Boxplot Method on test data
univOutliers(data1, "var1", method = "boxplot")
#> 
#> Using boxplot method for var1 
#> Outliers detected for var1 :
#> Row 18 : 23.43545 
#> Row 59 : 20.0691 

univOutliers(data1, "var2", method = "boxplot")
#> 
#> Using boxplot method for var2 
#> Outliers detected for var2 :
#> Row 18 : 77.01891 
#> Row 98 : 150 
#> Row 99 : 160 
#> Row 100 : 170 

univOutliers(data1, method = "boxplot")
#> 
#> Using boxplot method for var1 
#> Outliers detected for var1 :
#> Row 18 : 23.43545 
#> Row 59 : 20.0691 

#> 
#> Using boxplot method for var2 
#> Outliers detected for var2 :
#> Row 18 : 77.01891 
#> Row 98 : 150 
#> Row 99 : 160 
#> Row 100 : 170 

#> 
#> Using boxplot method for var3 
#> No outliers detected for var3 


# MAD Method on test data
univOutliers(data1, "var1", method = "mad")
#> 
#> Using mad method for var1 
#> Outliers detected for var1 :
#> Row 59 : 20.0691 

univOutliers(data1, "var2", method = "mad")
#> 
#> Using mad method for var2 
#> Outliers detected for var2 :
#> Row 18 : 77.01891 
#> Row 98 : 150 
#> Row 99 : 160 
#> Row 100 : 170 

univOutliers(data1, method = "mad")
#> 
#> Using mad method for var1 
#> Outliers detected for var1 :
#> Row 59 : 20.0691 

#> 
#> Using mad method for var2 
#> Outliers detected for var2 :
#> Row 18 : 77.01891 
#> Row 98 : 150 
#> Row 99 : 160 
#> Row 100 : 170 

#> 
#> Using mad method for var3 
#> Outliers detected for var3 :


# Grubbs' Method on test data
univOutliers(data1, "var1", method = "grubbs")
#> 
#> Using grubbs method for var1 

#> Outliers detected for var1 :
#> No outliers detected for var1 
univOutliers(data1, "var2", method = "grubbs")
#> 
#> Using grubbs method for var2 

#> Outliers detected for var2 :
#> Row 98 : 150 
#> Row 99 : 160 
#> Row 100 : 170 
univOutliers(data1, "var3", method = "grubbs")
#> 
#> Using grubbs method for var3 

#> Outliers detected for var3 :
#> No outliers detected for var3
